snippet: Hurricane Sandy severely damaged 44 buildings that house public schools in New York City, forcing some students to attend class at other locations.
abstract: Education Department Chancellor Dennis M Walcott says that New York City public school students will return to classes on November 5, but that storm damage to some buildings means some students will be relocated to other schools.
lead_paragraph: Hurricane Sandy severely damaged 44 buildings that house public schools in New York City, forcing some students to attend class at other locations.

headline.seo: New York City Schools, Some Relocated, Are to Reopen Monday
headline.main: Schools, Some Relocated, Will Reopen Monday
headline.print_headline: Schools, Some Relocated, Will Reopen Monday
